snippet: A son-in-law of Osama bin Laden who once served as a spokesman for Al Qaeda, Sulaiman Abu Ghaith, was charged with conspiring to kill Americans.
abstract: Sulaiman Abu Ghaith, son-in-law of Osama bin Laden who once served as spokesman for Al Qaeda, pleads not guilty at his arraignment in federal court in Manhattan, where he is charged with conspiring to kill Americans.

byline.original: By MARC SANTORA and WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM
byline.contributor: Mark Mazzetti and Ravi Somaiya contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: A son-in-law of Osama bin Laden who once served as a spokesman for Al Qaeda, Sulaiman Abu Ghaith, was charged with conspiring to kill Americans.

headline.seo: Sulaiman Abu Ghaith, Bin Laden’s Son-in-Law, Charged in New York
headline.main: Bin Laden Relative Pleads Not Guilty in Terrorism Case
headline.print_headline: In Courtroom Near Ground Zero, Bin Laden Relative Pleads Not Guilty
